summary: REQ-11 appears implemented via a configurable canonical link tag in `frontend/index.html` and (per file summary) runtime configuration in `frontend/src/main.tsx`. REQ-10 is partially evidenced: a new custom-domain setup doc was added and includes prerequisites, required values, and DNS steps, but the diff is truncated before showing the full IC registration steps/checklist and the required troubleshooting/verification section.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add a documented, step-by-step process for connecting a custom domain to the deployed Internet Computer website, including IC configuration steps and troubleshooting/verification guidance.
missing_requirements.reason: The added guide shows prerequisites, required information, and DNS record instructions, but the diff content is truncated mid-way (at the start of the "Using dfx" command section). The required checklist completeness and the troubleshooting/verification section are not directly evidenced in the visible content.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend code changed to a minimal/empty actor with a comment stating no backend changes are needed for custom domains.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest focuses on documentation (REQ-10) and frontend canonical metadata (REQ-11). No backend changes were requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/mentioned Internet Identity provider initialization in the frontend entry point.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not request adding or changing authentication behavior/providers; it only requests canonical URL metadata and documentation. The diff summary claims `frontend/src/main.tsx` initializes an Internet Identity provider.
